docs.lead_paragraph: A visit to the A.P.C. store in SoHo proves to be a study in stylish restraint.
docs.snippet: A visit to the A.P.C. store in SoHo proves to be a study in stylish restraint.

docs.lead_paragraph: 10 P.M. (Bravo) TIM GUNN'S GUIDE TO STYLE Watch out, Stacy London and Clinton Kelly. Mr. Gunn, the secret weapon of ''Project Runway,'' and his sidekick, the model Veronica Webb, left, are stepping onto your ''What Not to Wear'' turf in this new makeover series -- a gentler version of that TLC show. The premise is similar: a fashion failure is forced to make a nearly clean sweep of her closet by dividing its contents into tossers, menders, giveaways and just a few keepers. She is then taken shopping by Ms. Webb and Mr. Gunn, who culls advice from his book ''Tim Gunn: A Guide to Quality Taste and Style.'' In tonight's premiere he advises Rebecca Pennino of Hoboken, N.J. The worst part (or the best, given the outcome): opening up her lingerie drawer to Ms. Webb. 8 P.M. (NBC) N.F.L. OPENING KICKOFF SPECIAL 2007 The New Orleans Saints face off against the Indianapolis Colts in the league's 88th-season opener, which pays tribute to the Colts' Super Bowl victory and the city the team calls home. A pregame show features performances by Faith Hill, Kelly Clarkson, Hinder and Indiana's own John Mellencamp at the RCA Dome. Kickoff is 8:30.

docs.lead_paragraph: The threat of a taxicab strike -- the first since 2004 -- has cast new light on the complex economics of taxicabs in the city.

headline.main: Threat of Taxi Strike Puts Focus on Changing Industry

docs.abstract: Changes in the organization of the taxicab industry are behind some of the dissatisfaction voiced by drivers threatening to strike this week.

docs.lead_paragraph: Members of Congress return to Washington today and immediately get down to business, starting a month likely to be dominated by clashes over Iraq policy and federal spending.

headline.main: Congress Returns to Face Iraq, Budget Battles

docs.abstract: Putting summer recess behind them, the Senate and House begin to tackle domestic spending issues and the course of the war.

docs.lead_paragraph: Emboldened by Toyota’s plans to cut labor costs, the United Auto Workers is making its most concerted push yet to organize at the Japanese automaker’s largest American plant.
